title: Iranian president says he’ll only meet Trump after US drops sanctions
text:
Iranian President Hassan Rouhani | Spencer Platt/Getty Images Iranian president says he’ll only meet Trump after US drops sanctions ‘Without the U.S.’s withdrawal from sanctions, we will not witness any positive development.’

Iranian President Hassan Rouhani on Tuesday said he would be willing to meet with President Donald Trump only if the United States lifts its crushing economic sanctions on Tehran.

“Without the U.S.’s withdrawal from sanctions, we will not witness any positive development,” Rouhani said in a televised speech, warning: “If someone intends to make it as just a photo op with Rouhani, that is not possible.”

Rouhani’s remarks, reported by the Associated Press, contrast with comments he made on Monday, when he expressed a greater willingness to sit for talks with Trump and asserted that Tehran and Washington “should not miss opportunities” for diplomatic engagement.

“If I knew that going to a meeting and visiting a person would help my country’s development and resolve the problems of the people, I would not miss it,” Rouhani said, according to the AP. “Even if the odds of success are not 90 percent but are 20 percent or 10 percent, we must move ahead with it.”

Trump on Monday signaled fresh optimism that he and Rouhani would soon get together to address the escalating tensions between their two countries, which have ramped up steadily since the U.S. withdrew from the 2015 multinational nuclear deal with Iran last year.

"The sanctions are absolutely hurting them horribly," Trump told reporters during a news conference at the G7 summit in Biarritz, France. "I don't want to see that. But we can't let them have a nuclear weapon. So I think there is a really good chance we would meet."
description: ‘Without the U.S.’s withdrawal from sanctions, we will not witness any positive development.’
